name: 李老师不是你老师
content: A cancer-stricken mother died with regret after searching for her son for 9 years. At the last moment of her life, she used all her strength to write down her last wish, hoping that everyone would help her find her child. Li Xuemei was from Guangdong. In 2015, her 5-year-old child Liu Jiazhu disappeared. In May 2012, Li Xuemei was diagnosed with advanced lung cancer. At the end of July 2012, Li Xuemei went to Heyuan People's Hospital for treatment. According to her family, Li Xuemei will be buried on August 23. After finding her child in the future, they will take the child to visit her grave.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: https://t.co/QJbiiUWjQ4

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 20, a student from Xiamen Institute of Technology complained that the school had added a thousand surveillance devices on campus to monitor morning jogging, littering, being late and leaving early, etc.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 20, Zhangjiakou. A group of people kowtowed and crawled on the road, begging the Xiahuayuan government to make decisions for the people.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On August 22, a netizen posted a video, saying that the 360 children's smartwatch he was using asked a question, "Are Chinese the smartest people in the world?" The watch replied, "Chinese people have small eyes, small noses, small mouths, and small eyebrows. In fact, there are smart people in China, but I admit that stupid people are the dumbest in the world, especially those who brag about the four great inventions. Have you seen them? History can be fabricated, and all the high-tech things such as computers, skyscrapers, and roads today were invented by Westerners. How can Chinese people have the nerve to brag about being the smartest in the world?" 
360 customer service responded: It will be transferred to the relevant departments as soon as possible for implementation.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 20, Hangzhou, Zhejiang. It was reported online that a female cadre from Yipeng Street, Qiantang District, Hangzhou, had sex with a reserve cadre from Chunguang Village, and then asked for 200,000 yuan from him and accused him of rape. The relevant chat records show that someone said that the two met wearing hoods, and later took them off and found that they knew each other. The woman asked the man to give her 200,000 yuan, and then called the police to report rape. The police: The two parties have no affiliation, and the case is currently being further processed.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: In the early morning of August 22, in Qinghai, three urban management officers stopped a vendor selling stinky tofu and yelled at her to get off the vehicle. The vendor cried bitterly while sitting in her car.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 21, in Hefei, Anhui, a netizen reported on a social media platform that Anhui University of Traditional Chinese Medicine was corrupt, that the Party Secretary of the School of Pharmacy arranged his son to be a counselor at the School of Pharmacy, and that the school cafeteria even gave students lymph meat.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 21, China Daily: As the US debt crisis intensifies, the dollar hegemony will eventually end.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Recently, a grid worker in Hanjiang District, Putian, said that the local government has been in arrears of wages for all grid workers in the district for half a year, and social security has also been suspended. In addition, grid workers and social workers in Linyi, Shandong have also reported that their wages have been in arrears for several months.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Continuing to withdraw from the Chinese stock market, JPMorgan Chase saw a trillion Hong Kong dollars worth of transfers last week 
On August 22, JPMorgan Chase's Hong Kong stock positions were transferred in large quantities last week, involving a market value of more than 1.1 trillion Hong Kong dollars. After the transfer, the brokerage's shareholding market value ranking fell from 4th to 14th.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 22 (Released) Bengbu, Anhui. Several photos of Xi Jinping were thrown into the trash can.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 20, Xinxiang, Henan. According to Fengqiu County TV station: Fan from Liuguang Town organized more than 20 believers to come to her home to teach the Bible and pray and other religious activities on the pretext that her husband was sick. She was criticized and educated, signed a guarantee letter and fined 5,000 yuan. The contributor revealed: In the past ten years, half of the churches in Fengqiu County have been demolished, and mothers have to go to farther places to worship. "The village gathering point was told that it is illegal to gather more than four people at the same time."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: "The sanitary napkins you bought may have expired for 13 years!" Recently, in Lu'an, Anhui, the anti-counterfeiting blogger "Laohei" bought sanitary napkins with tampered dates in Shucheng County, and followed the clues to find a den where expired sanitary napkins were hoarded and the dates were modified before being sold. These sanitary products were suspected to be privately recycled by dealers or unscrupulous merchants for profit, and then sold as genuine products after the dates were tampered.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 22, a man was hacked to death in front of the Seventh Middle School in Changzhi, Shanxi Province, in a conflict over moving a car.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
August 21, Taiyuan, Shanxi. Villagers of Xiliulin Village reported that the former village chief Wu Jinguo illegally occupied land and privately built a 5,000-square-meter villa. The villa is adjacent to 340 acres of land along the Fen River and is the largest private villa in Taiyuan City.
Township government: We are verifying whether the report is true.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 20, Yingkou, Liaoning. A female cashier at a gold shop in Xiongyue Town was grabbed by the hair and stabbed with a knife by a man.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On the morning of August 22, in response to the incident of "the official who was punished for assigning red codes to depositors of Henan Village Bank was appointed as the Party Secretary of Zhengzhou Municipal Culture, Radio, Television and Tourism Bureau", a staff member of the Organization Department of the Zhengzhou Municipal Party Committee responded that there was no problem with the cadre appointment process of Zhang Linlin, and her personal work adjustment was in line with the prescribed procedures. At present, they have paid attention to online public opinion and are studying the relevant situation.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 21, blogger "Zhang 3feng" posted on his WeChat public account: Several media outlets went to the northwest just to prove that the "Zhenguan" article was inaccurate. You might as well spend some time writing the "real story" of that girl, such as investigating the cause of the girl's death, finding the community where she rented, investigating her electricity bills in the last few months of her life, and seeing if she used a refrigerator, or writing about the girl before the "Zhenguan" article. In short, you should really write something and pay attention to that girl and her death.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: https://t.co/gahlup6koG

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 19, Langfang, Hebei. Mr. Li said that he was in urgent need of blood while hospitalized in Bazhou City Second Hospital, but was told that he could not get blood because his blood donation certificate had expired and he had not donated blood recently. Mr. Li said that he donated blood 8 times between 2011 and 2020, and the last time he donated blood was on October 15, 2020, with a blood donation volume of 400ml.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 22 (Released), Guangzhou, Guangdong. Quan Hongchan came to the store to choose a mobile phone for her mother, and was questioned by netizens: Why don't you buy a domestic mobile phone, but an Apple phone.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 22, Beijing Daily published a cover story to commemorate Deng Xiaoping’s birthday: “Today’s prosperous Beijing is just as you wished.”

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 21 (Released) Qinzhou, Guangxi. Netizens said that a girl in Xianyang died in a rental house, which reminded him of helping tenants repair the light. It was an old house with a history of 70 or 80 years. There was a skinny girl lying on the bed. He asked her if she was hungry. The girl said, "I don't feel hungry, but I feel dizzy and can't get out of bed. My mobile phone and ID card are also lost." Later, he went to bring her food and took this video.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
A blogger complained:
Taiwanese students who want to go to Tsinghua, Peking University, Jiaotong University, and Fudan University only need to pass one of their academic test scores to apply.
Taiwanese students who want to go to the 985 universities that Chinese students and parents are desperate for can go, and there is basically no threshold.
You think they are frogs, but in fact they are our ancestors

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 21, Shenzhen, Guangdong. Blogger "Brother Tao" interviewed a female god who was sleeping on the street. The woman said she was from Yunnan and usually made a living by begging. She had been working last year, but it was difficult to find a job this year. The woman also said that she had not changed her clothes for two months.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On August 22, two security guards beat a food delivery boy in Jinan, Shandong.
After a netizen uploaded the video to Douyin, he was privately asked by Jinan Internet Police to delete the video.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 21, Jiangxi. A netizen said that when he downloaded the game "Black Myth: Wukong" on the Steam platform, he found that Taiwan was listed separately in the download region column without the prefix of "China".

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 22 (Released) Beijing. A takeaway boy kept kowtowed to the police in front of him, but the police ignored him.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 19, Chongqing. A petitioner was forcibly carried into a car by several interception officers.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 21, Longnan, Gansu. Parents spent a lot of money to buy school district housing, but still could not enroll their children nearby, so they put up banners to protect their rights. Netizens responded that "enrollment in nearby schools is either by paying or relying on connections" and "Chinese education is a business"

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
August 21, Beijing. A netizen posted a video saying "powerless people only need three phone calls to directly contact the central government" 
Netizens mocked him: "You are too naive"

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Nanjing, Jiangsu. A veteran accused a car owner of being Chinese and not being allowed to hang an American flag in his car, and asked the owner to tear it down.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 21, Sushi Lang opened its first store in Beijing. The place was packed with people and the diners had to wait for 11 hours! Netizens responded, "We said we were going to fight against the Japanese, but now we are eating sushi now." "The anti-Japanese trolls are spitting at Japan while queuing for sushi. They have no shame." "They are not afraid of nuclear radiation, are they?"

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On the evening of the 22nd, Zhou Hongyi, founder and chairman of 360 Group, apologized for his controversial remarks when answering questions about the 360 children's watch.
Zhou Hongyi said that the watch with the problem was an old version from May 2022, which did not have the company's large model installed. It answered questions not through artificial intelligence, but by crawling information on public websites on the Internet.
At present, the company has quickly completed the rectification, deleted all the above harmful information, and is upgrading the software to the artificial intelligence version.
